author: Staff Reporter
text:
A Public Interest Litigation (PIL) petition was filed in the Rajasthan High Court on Monday, seeking shift of the Jaipur Literature Festival (JLF) from the current venue — Hotel Diggi Palace — to a place that can accommodate the crowd that attends literary meet to be organised between January 21 and 25, to address the “traffic jam” and “a possible stampede” issues.

‘Not suitable’

The petitioner, RTI activist Sanjeev Gupta said in the petition that about 35,000 people arrive each day at the JLF. However, “the place is suitable for only 2,000 people” each day, he said.
title: Plea to shift venue of Jaipur Literary Festival
